text: hundreds missing after ferry accident
kathleen sebelius is political future
and Facebook's gamble on apps today on
the New York Times minute tragic images
from South Korea where hundreds are
missing and feared dead after a ferry
carrying 459 people capsized off the
southeast coast most aboard were high
school students the story is still
developing in politics Kathleen Sebelius
is already thinking about her next move
a week after the embattled Health and
Human Services Secretary announced her
resignation news that the former
governor is considering a return to
Kansas to run for Senate it's difficult
territory for Democrats but her chances
may improve if incumbent Senator Pat
Roberts loses in the primaries to tea
party candidate Milton Wolf's stories
come in all shapes and sizes
and Facebook is betting big on mobile
apps the effort is called creative labs
with the mission of unbundling Facebook
the news services may not even show
Facebook's branding but expect plenty of
ads as you install these apps mobile is
the heart of Facebook's advertising
revenue
Oh
